e05286ac-fb5a-476c-a68d-b64066da3169.description: The earner demonstrated an understanding of Lean Thinking and how it can be used by individuals and teams to improve customer satisfaction, reduce errors, increase efficiencies, and work more effectively with teams to solve problems during an 8-hour introductory session.
e05286ac-fb5a-476c-a68d-b64066da3169.name: Lean for Leaders

badge_template_activities.title: Understand the value Lean Thinking (or a Plan, Do, Check, Act approach) brings to an organization
Recognize Lean as a management philosophy that has the potential to impact on an organization’s culture and bottom-line
Compare and contrast the ways in which Lean Thinking is similar to or different from other quality initiatives
Utilize Lean methods and tools to solve everyday problems presented in the simulation exercise
Design control plans and counter measures to sustain organizational improvements
Attend and complete the workshop
Apply concepts learned in the simulations to demonstrate improvement of processes
Understand the critical success factors that make Lean work in an organization
Become familiar with a full set of Lean tools, focusing on when to use them, how to use them, and why to use them

754f6a5a-6b73-4397-8124-bd5a674e92bb.description: The earner can create spaces of neutrality for facilitated dialogues engaging their community. Earners are able to set shared expectations in meetings, utilize facilitation strategies, incorporate effective facilitative behaviors in practice, formulate and implement dialogue expanding questions and create personalized facilitative intake process to ensure they are guiding groups effectively.
754f6a5a-6b73-4397-8124-bd5a674e92bb.name: Facilitation Basics for Research and Extension Professionals

badge_template_activities.title: Complete culminating facilitation activity with 70% grade or higher
Complete all assignments and quizzes with 70% grade or higher

f8fc99cb-8d54-40bc-936b-c23f43909d24.description: The earner has demonstrated effective grant development and management techniques by identifying funding sources, generating a fundable proposal, writing convincing and well-supported needs statements, designing a strong budget, and understanding the key components of project planning.
f8fc99cb-8d54-40bc-936b-c23f43909d24.name: Grant Development and Management

badge_template_activities.title: Develop a grant proposal outline, a draft proposal, or a final proposal for review.
Successfully complete five of seven weekly mini-assignments in the course.
Participate in one of the live Zoom check-in discussions.

546baa0f-903d-4d73-b405-d35c43174e83.description: The earner demonstrated their skills and competencies in constructing a well-crafted strategy for innovation. The earner is now able to identify sources of innovation, how innovations are frequently categorized, and why some innovations are more successful than others.
546baa0f-903d-4d73-b405-d35c43174e83.name: Introduction to Strategic Innovation

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and present an approved capstone project utilizing acquired skills.
Review of risks and costs of innovation, why firms are much more likely to be successful if they have a well-crafted strategy for innovation.

7b058dc1-a2ae-4143-a972-9834275f4e91.description: The earner demonstrated their data analysis skills using Python. The earner is now capable of collecting, manipulating, visualizing, and analyzing business data.
7b058dc1-a2ae-4143-a972-9834275f4e91.name: Fundamentals of Data Analytics

badge_template_activities.title: Review of Python bootcamp; implement web scraping techniques; employ Pandas to illustrate business intelligence; apply data visualization using Python
Complete and present an approved capstone project utilizing acquired skills

Learn to capture data from databases, websites, and social media; use data wrangling techniques to process real-world data for analysis; develop skills to extract business intelligence from business data; apply data visualization techniques to develop insights from data

f7cd66bc-d8f8-4624-ab9f-1edc04d9da6c.description: Earner demonstrates the ability to write the essential components of a grant including problem statement, outcomes, activities, evaluation and budget. Earner demonstrates their ability to identify the inputs, outputs (activities and participation), short, medium, and long-term outcomes/impact.
f7cd66bc-d8f8-4624-ab9f-1edc04d9da6c.name: Grant Writing Basics

badge_template_activities.title: 1) Complete a "Grant Worksheet" outlining the grant elements of a project: problem/situation statement, outcomes, activities, evaluation.
2) Create a simple grant budget with narrative.
3) Create a logic model.
Participate in 7 hours of Grant Writing Basics instruction in person or online and create the supporting documents illustrating basic understanding of the essential elements of a grant.

b3cfaecf-2fa8-4617-bc31-80ba8e8239c4.description: Earner is certified by the FAA as a remote pilot; understands the safety and legal considerations for small UAS within the national airspace; can operate small multirotor aircraft in basic fundamentals; can apply knowledge in airspace classification, meteorology, emergency procedures, and aeronautical decision making during UAS operations.
b3cfaecf-2fa8-4617-bc31-80ba8e8239c4.name: sUAS Pilot

alignments.name: 14 CFR Part 107
alignments.description: In order to fly your drone under the FAA's Small UAS Rule (Part 107), you must obtain a Remote Pilot Certificate from the Federal Aviation Administration. This certificate demonstrates that you understand the regulations, operating requirements, and procedures for safely flying drones.

badge_template_activities.title: Attend sUAS Commercial Remote Pilot Training
Pass the FAA aeronautical knowledge exam: "Unmanned Aircraft General – Small (UAG)"
Demonstrate proficiency of knowledge in Basic Multirotor Flight Training

d645ad0f-4459-4aa7-a005-849c61fa986d.description: The learner will demonstrate expertise in systematically and consistently reinforcing positive behaviors; guiding students towards positive behaviors without bribes, demands, or anger; and teaching positive behaviors through learning opportunities without losing instructional time and without giving undue attention to negative behaviors.
d645ad0f-4459-4aa7-a005-849c61fa986d.name: How to Build Relationships, Share Control, and Teach Positive Behaviors

badge_template_activities.title: Earners increased their capacities to manage classrooms through instruction, literature review, implementation of research-based strategies, artifacts to demonstrate growth over time and a final reflection on learning.
Earners attended a workshop, completed a literature review, created a unique project for their schools and then shared their experiences through a portfolio.
Participants earned one hour of college credit.

f036dcfc-e66a-4c12-8d6d-c10a30075ec5.description: The learner will demonstrate expertise in strategies for becoming more mindful of teachers' inner lives; teaching practices to address student/classroom SEL challenges effectively; and strategies for communicating above and below line emotions to better serve students so all thrive.
f036dcfc-e66a-4c12-8d6d-c10a30075ec5.name: The Inner Life of the Professional Educator: Strategies for Surviving and Thriving

badge_template_activities.title: Earners increased their capacities to manage classrooms through instruction, literature review, implementation of research-based strategies, artifacts to demonstrate growth over time and a final reflection on learning.
Earners attended a workshop, completed a literature review, created a unique project for their schools and then shared their experiences through a portfolio.
Participants earned one hour of college credit.

b5939488-3fda-4728-b5c6-80305cca59e1.description: The earner demonstrated the ability to use specific tools to create and analyze financial statements and budgets, thus making informed business decisions.
b5939488-3fda-4728-b5c6-80305cca59e1.name: Using Financial Data to Transform Your Small Business

badge_template_activities.title: Understand the value of using financial statements to make decisions in your business
Understand the power of budgeting for proactive decision-making (as opposed to reactive) in your business
Learn to answer questions such as: Why don’t I have more cash? How much should I charge? Should I increase prices? Where are my costs increasing?
Create financial statements for the fictitious company: World’s Best Cup of Coffee
Create financial statement forecasts and budgets (based on current financial statements and future expectations) for World’s Best Cup of Coffee
Demonstrate your mastery of the badge concepts by completing the quiz. You may retake the quiz up to three times; only your highest score will count.
Identify and demonstrate the effects of transactions and economic events on the financial statements in corporations and other business entities.
Prepare the fundamental financial statements.
Analyze and interpret the information presented in the financial statements.
Measure the value of assets, liabilities, and stockholders’ equity (including an introduction to fair value accounting).
Project/forecast the financial statements
Construct basic budgets based on financial statement forecasts
Use the financial statements (current and projected) and budgets to make informed business decisions
Understand how to use financial statements and budgets to make good "data driven" business decisions.

324cb5e9-ffa1-4f2a-a4a6-f9126949a908.description: The earner learned the foundational concepts and skills needed to create content on a number of platforms. Through hands-on graded assignments, earners put into practice what they learned in these classes, received feedback on ways to improve, and developed content creation skills.
324cb5e9-ffa1-4f2a-a4a6-f9126949a908.name: Content Creation

badge_template_activities.title: Learn the foundational skills needed for content creation on multiple platforms.
Demonstrate the skills needed to create, distribute, and assess content across platforms.

Six college credits earned from the following 1-credit hour courses: Audio Essentials, Photography Essentials, Video Essentials, Social Media Essentials, Creative Design, Content Management for Distribution, Podcasting Essentials

8a262ee8-e397-4cc3-a56d-9cd7303aa809.description: The earner applied divergent facilitation tools to generate ideas, create possibilities, create buy in, honor diverse perspectives, and help move groups past limitations to solutions. Participants were able to explain each tool (Bridge Building/Gap Analysis; Affinity Diagrams; Mind Mapping; Fishbone Diagrams; Sticky Walls; Rotating Flip Charts; and Brainstorming) and identified cases for use and application. Earner built scaffolded facilitated community dialogue.
8a262ee8-e397-4cc3-a56d-9cd7303aa809.name: Facilitation Divergent Tools for Research and Extension Professionals

badge_template_activities.title: Complete culminating facilitation activity with 70% grade or higher
Complete all assignments and quizzes with 70% grade or higher

cac127b9-541b-43ac-8389-ee5d765968f2.description: The earner demonstrated the ability to create and apply mathematical models in real-world situations. Mathematical modeling is the art and science of developing a mathematical procedure for predicting real-world outputs from real-world inputs, frequently including recommending optimal procedures for a situation. This is a vital skill that is highly valued in the workforce.
cac127b9-541b-43ac-8389-ee5d765968f2.name: Microcredential in Mathematical Modeling

badge_template_activities.title: Earners can identify and extract information from unprepared real-world sources, identify and use multiple modeling strategies to predict output values from input data and can propose appropriate actions based on a model.
Earners identify what data they need, determining the appropriate modeling technique, and explain the implications of their model to an outside entity.
Earner ranks in the successful or higher category in the Mathematical Contest in Modeling.
Successfully complete Modeling Seminar (1 credit) or Preparation for Industrial Careers (3 credits)

28cb96c5-3174-400e-80e4-0dbaf59938b8.description: The badge earner has mastered the concepts of adult development and ageism. They're able to recognize ageist words, practices, policies, and critical issues facing older adults. They've mastered strategies for avoiding and responding to ageist practices, understand best practices for communicating with older adults, and demonstrated how they will apply their learning to their profession.
28cb96c5-3174-400e-80e4-0dbaf59938b8.name: Working with Older Adults in Cooperative Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Pass a cumulative assessment with a score of 70% or higher.
Successful completion of a brief culminating reflection explaining how the learning experience contributed to the learner's profession.
Complete the required course modules.
